intro: Echinopsis formosa subsp. bruchii, commonly known as the Bruch's moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and a dense covering of white to pale blue spines. The plant produces showy, night-blooming flowers that range in color from pink to violet, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for xerophytic environments. Due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
